original: @290a // na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: @290a // na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya.

original: na mashtsanda badzra p'a nam ye ma h'a yaksha se na pa ta ya /
analyzed: na mashtsanda badzra p'a nam ye ma h'a yaksha se na pa ta ya /
translated: Namo ścaṇḍavajrapāṇaye mahāyakṣasenāpataye.

original: tadya th'a / aom dzva ra gri nu dzva ra gri nu gardza gardza /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom dzva ra gri nu dzva ra gri nu gardza gardza /
translated: Tadyathā. Oṃ jvālāgrīṇu jvālāgrīṇu garja garja.

original: tstshardu tstshardu / munytsa munytsa /
analyzed: tstshardu tstshardu / munytsa munytsa /
translated: Cchurda cchurda muñca muñca.

original: nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / nyin bzhi pa dang / rims mi bzad pa rnams /
analyzed: nyin gcig pa dang / nyin gnyis pa dang / nyin gsum pa dang / nyin bzhi pa dang / rims mi bzad pa rnams /
translated: One-day, two-day, three-day, four-day, and uncurable fevers,

original: aa ta ha ta phyag na rdo rje'i bka' @290b bzhin du /🔽hu ru hu ru /
analyzed: aa ta ha ta phyag na rdo rje'i bka' @290b bzhin du / hu ru hu ru /
translated: according to the command of Vajrapāṇi,🔽hurururu.

original: dhu na dhu na /
analyzed: dhu na dhu na /
translated: Dhuna dhuna.

original: bi dhu na bi dhu na /
analyzed: bi dhu na bi dhu na /
translated: Vidhuna vidhuna.

original: si ri munytsa ka n'am munytsa tva zhi da yam munytsa munytsa /
analyzed: si ri munytsa ka n'am munytsa tva zhi da yam munytsa munytsa /
translated: Sirī muñca kāṃ muñcatvaṃ śīdyaṃ muñca muñca.

original: da da ram munytsa /
analyzed: da da ram munytsa /
translated: Dadraṃ muñca.

original: ka ti munytsa munytsa kantha munytsa /
analyzed: ka ti munytsa munytsa kantha munytsa /
translated: Kaṭiṃ muñca muñca kaṇṭhaṃ muñca.

original: hasti munydza / b'a do munytsa h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat che ge mo'i rims nyams par gyis shig sv'a h'a /
analyzed: hasti munydza / b'a do munytsa h'um h'um h'um phat phat phat che ge mo'i rims nyams par gyis shig sv'a h'a /
translated: Hastī muñca vāḍī muñca hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ. Weaken such-and-such's fever. Svāhā.

original: rims bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: rims bzlog pa'o //
translated: This is for averting fever.

original: dbang po'i nas dang / zhu mkhan dang / pu she tsi dang ma sar /
analyzed: dbang po'i nas dang / zhu mkhan dang / pu she tsi dang ma sar /
translated: The root of indrahasti, śuktimukha, puṣīka, and masūra,

original: spos dkar / pa ma /
analyzed: spos dkar / pa ma /
translated: White camphor, pāma,

original: b'i t'a / ni phata'i 'dab ma rnams gcig tu byas nas btags te gdong la byugs na gdong zla ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: b'i t'a / ni phata'i 'dab ma rnams gcig tu byas nas btags te gdong la byugs na gdong zla ba lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: and vit are made into one paste and applied to the face. The face becomes like the moon.

original: k'a ma y'a'i rtsa ba gtsug tu bcings na gnyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: k'a ma y'a'i rtsa ba gtsug tu bcings na gnyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the root of kāmayā is bound on the head, one will fall asleep.

original: ku th'a ratstshinma'i rtsa ba khar bcug na ral gri la sogs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: ku th'a ratstshinma'i rtsa ba khar bcug na ral gri la sogs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: If the root of kuṭharacchī is placed in the mouth, it wards off swords and so forth.

original: aa lam mu sh'a'i rtsa ba rna ba gnyis la bcings na rims nyin bzhi pa nyams par byed do //
analyzed: aa lam mu sh'a'i rtsa ba rna ba gnyis la bcings na rims nyin bzhi pa nyams par byed do //
translated: If the root of alamusī is bound on both ears, it wards off quartan fever.

original: dur khrod du skyes pa'i dro na pushpa'i khu bas mig bkang na mig gi me tog sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dur khrod du skyes pa'i dro na pushpa'i khu bas mig bkang na mig gi me tog sel bar byed do //
translated: If the eyes are filled with the juice of the flower that grows in the charnel ground, it removes the flower of the eye.

original: kshu dgra  ai ni ka'i rtsa ba dang / gi wam lhan cig btags nas thig le byas na rgyal po'i sgor mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kshu dgra  ai ni ka'i rtsa ba dang / gi wam lhan cig btags nas thig le byas na rgyal po'i sgor mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If a paste of the root of kṣudrakī and long pepper is made into a pill, it is supreme at the door of the king.

original: shri g'a la bstu k'a'i rtsa ba rna ba la bcings na mig nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: shri g'a la bstu k'a'i rtsa ba rna ba la bcings na mig nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If the root of śrīgālabastuka is bound on the ear, it removes eye disease.

original: sa kho ta ka'i rtsa bas mgul nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sa kho ta ka'i rtsa bas mgul nad sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of sakhoṭaka removes throat disease.

original: bhu mi tsam pa ka'i rtsa ba btags nas btungs na lto ba'i zug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bhu mi tsam pa ka'i rtsa ba btags nas btungs na lto ba'i zug sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of bhūmīka ground with water, it will remove stomach pain.

original: dka' thub pa'i chu 'ongs pa dang / 'bras s'a lu dang / 'bras thug po che dang / ka ra dkar po dang lhan cig btungs na bud med rnams kyi khrag 'bab pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dka' thub pa'i chu 'ongs pa dang / 'bras s'a lu dang / 'bras thug po che dang / ka ra dkar po dang lhan cig btungs na bud med rnams kyi khrag 'bab pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the water of ascetics together with śāli rice, masūra beans, and white sugar, it will remove the flow of blood in women.

original: tri shru li ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na glang po che dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tri shru li ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na glang po che dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts the root of triśūlikā in one’s mouth, one will control elephants.

original: bri ha t'i dkar po'i rtsa ba 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags nas btungs na rde nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bri ha t'i dkar po'i rtsa ba 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags nas btungs na rde nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of white bṛhatī ground with water, it will remove dysentery.

original: su b'anna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba dar ba dang lhan cig btags nas byug pa byas na khyi rngo sel bar byed do //
analyzed: su b'anna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba dar ba dang lhan cig btags nas byug pa byas na khyi rngo sel bar byed do //
translated: If one makes a paste of the root of subānapālikā together with curd and applies it, it will remove dog bites.

original: mngon par bgrod pa'i dus su aagni bastu ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na mod la bud med dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par bgrod pa'i dus su aagni bastu ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na mod la bud med dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts the root of agniṣṭhūlā in one’s mouth at the time of intercourse, one will immediately control a woman.

original: aa la mu sh'a'i rtsa ba kam dzi ka dang btags @291a * //
analyzed: aa la mu sh'a'i rtsa ba kam dzi ka dang btags @291a * //
translated: If one drinks the root of ālamūṣī together with kamjīka,

original: nas mgo bo la byabs na mgo'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: nas mgo bo la byabs na mgo'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one rubs [the root of] the white thorn-apple on one's head, it will cure head diseases.

original: aarka dkar po'i rtsa ba dar ba dang btags nas btungs na mig ser sel bar byed do //
analyzed: aarka dkar po'i rtsa ba dar ba dang btags nas btungs na mig ser sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of the white arka plant, which has sprouted and is dried, it will cure jaundice.

original: n'a ga lam dz'a ti'i rtsa ba khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: n'a ga lam dz'a ti'i rtsa ba khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts the root of the nāgalatā into one's mouth, one will become invisible.

original: 'o ma dang lhan cig zos nas chags par byas na bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma dang lhan cig zos nas chags par byas na bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats it together with milk, one will become pregnant.

original: bhodza nanytsa ae ka ba la y'a dugdhi na sa ha k'a ra dang / mkhan pa'i rtsa ba dang / dro na pushpa'i rtsa ba dang / yung ba dang / 'bras thug po che lhan cig byas nas /
analyzed: bhodza nanytsa ae ka ba la y'a dugdhi na sa ha k'a ra dang / mkhan pa'i rtsa ba dang / dro na pushpa'i rtsa ba dang / yung ba dang / 'bras thug po che lhan cig byas nas /
translated: One should make a paste of the root of the bhojanīyaka, the root of the ekavallī, and the root of the droṇa flower, together with indigo and rice,

original: dri la phyi byas te /
analyzed: dri la phyi byas te /
translated: and make it into a pill.

original: chus bkrus na gsal por smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus bkrus na gsal por smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one washes it with water, one will speak clearly.

original: de bzhin du n'a ga ge sar dang / stha la kumbh'i dang / n'a ga da ma na ka dang / da ma na ka pusha pa rnams kyi rtsa bas dril phyi byas te chus bkrus na /
analyzed: de bzhin du n'a ga ge sar dang / stha la kumbh'i dang / n'a ga da ma na ka dang / da ma na ka pusha pa rnams kyi rtsa bas dril phyi byas te chus bkrus na /
translated: In the same way, if one makes a pill with the root of the nāgavallī, the sthālakumbhī, the nāgadamana, and the damana flower, and washes it with water,

original: klu nor rgyas kyi bu'ang dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu nor rgyas kyi bu'ang dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: even the nāga Vāsuki will be brought under one's control.

original: na mashtsanda badzra p'a na ye ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: na mashtsanda badzra p'a na ye ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Namaḥ ścaṇḍavajrapāṇaye mahāyakṣasenāpataye |

original: tadya th'a / aa na le aa na le tu tu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aa na le aa na le tu tu sv'a h'a /
translated: Tadyathā | Anale anale tule svāhā |

original: sngags 'di tsha ba'i til mar la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags par byas te rkang pa gnyis la byugs na dpag tshad du mar mi ngal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags 'di tsha ba'i til mar la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags par byas te rkang pa gnyis la byugs na dpag tshad du mar mi ngal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This mantra, having been enchanted one hundred and eight times in hot oil, if applied to the two feet, one will be able to travel many yojanas without fatigue.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum byas pas so ;
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum byas pas so ;
translated: One should do one hundred thousand repetitions beforehand.

original: ; mkha' 'gro rnams kyis phyag rgya 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; mkha' 'gro rnams kyis phyag rgya 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dakinis will open the mudra.

original: bcings pa grol ba las bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa grol ba las bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite from the liberated bondage.

original: na ma: ku su m'a li k'a ya hi ma ra d'u re sa ba ri sv'a h'a /
analyzed: na ma: ku su m'a li k'a ya hi ma ra d'u re sa ba ri sv'a h'a /
translated: Namaḥ kusumālikāya himādriśikharavare svāhā |

original: byi ba sgrib par byed pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: byi ba sgrib par byed pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the obstructing mouse.

original: aa p'a marga'i rtsa ba la bdun bsngags pa'i srad bu yongs su bcings na rims nyin gcig pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: aa p'a marga'i rtsa ba la bdun bsngags pa'i srad bu yongs su bcings na rims nyin gcig pa sel bar byed do //
translated: A thread, having been enchanted seven times on the root of the apāmārga, if bound, will remove the one-day fever.

original: pa r'a ha kr'anta'i rtsa ba lag pa la bcings na lang tsho nyams pa la'ang bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa r'a ha kr'anta'i rtsa ba lag pa la bcings na lang tsho nyams pa la'ang bu 'byung ngo //
translated: If the root of the parāhaṭaka is bound on the hand, even one whose youth has declined will have a child.

original: dandotpa la'i rtsa ba dang / gi wam lhan cig btags nas thig le byas te rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na /
analyzed: dandotpa la'i rtsa ba dang / gi wam lhan cig btags nas thig le byas te rgyal po'i pho brang du zhugs na /
translated: If one makes a paste of the root of the white sweet flag and long pepper and places it on the forehead,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang la sogs pa yul 'khor gyi skye bo dga' bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang la sogs pa yul 'khor gyi skye bo dga' bar 'gyur ro /
translated: one will be able to enter the king's palace and so forth, and the people of the country will be pleased.

original: (phag gnon pa) / ka ko la'i rtsa ba phrad bar byas na so'i zug rdu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: (phag gnon pa) / ka ko la'i rtsa ba phrad bar byas na so'i zug rdu sel bar byed do //
translated: If one chews the root of the ka kola plant, it will remove toothache.

original: ta da sth'a kri ma ya:n'a sha ya ti /
analyzed: ta da sth'a kri ma ya:n'a sha ya ti /
translated: The mantra is: Tada sthakrimay nashayati.

original: bhri ga r'a dza'i rtsa ba dang / aa pa ra dzi ta'i rtsa ba dang / me tog phyungs @291b te mgrin par bcings na lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bhri ga r'a dza'i rtsa ba dang / aa pa ra dzi ta'i rtsa ba dang / me tog phyungs @291b te mgrin par bcings na lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
translated: If one ties the root of the bhringaraja plant, the root of the aparajita plant, and the flower of the karanja plant around one's neck, it will remove goiter.

original: bstu ka'i rtsa ba b'a sa'i chu dang bcas pa btungs na skya rbab kyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bstu ka'i rtsa ba b'a sa'i chu dang bcas pa btungs na skya rbab kyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of the bhringa plant together with the water of the vasaka plant, it will remove edema.

original: tikta la shu'i rtsab kanydzi ka dang btags te spyi bor byugs na mgo bo'i zug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: tikta la shu'i rtsab kanydzi ka dang btags te spyi bor byugs na mgo bo'i zug sel bar byed do //
translated: If one anoints the head with a paste of the root of the bitter plant and karanja, it will remove headache.🔽 If one drinks the root of the subarnakshiri plant together with honey,🔽 it will remove all diseases of the blood.

original: su barna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig btungs na /
analyzed: su barna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig btungs na /
translated: If one drinks the root of the white sweet flag together with the water of the vasaka plant,

original: dri chu 'gags pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dri chu 'gags pa sel bar byed do //
translated: It cures retention of urine.

original: sidzdza'i rtsa ba bu ram dang lhan cig zos na gnyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sidzdza'i rtsa ba bu ram dang lhan cig zos na gnyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats the root of sizz with molasses, one will fall asleep.

original: bata'i rtsa ba btags nas byin na mig ser sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bata'i rtsa ba btags nas byin na mig ser sel bar byed do //
translated: If one gives a potion of the root of bhat, it cures jaundice.

original: kanta k'a ra'i rtsa ba rked pa la bcings na mig nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: kanta k'a ra'i rtsa ba rked pa la bcings na mig nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one ties the root of kantakâra around one's waist, it cures eye diseases.

original: s'um patta dang / bhanydza na'i rtsa ba btags nas lga'i khu ba dang / rgyam tsha dang / til mar lhan cig bsres te rna ba bkang na rna ba'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: s'um patta dang / bhanydza na'i rtsa ba btags nas lga'i khu ba dang / rgyam tsha dang / til mar lhan cig bsres te rna ba bkang na rna ba'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
translated: If one fills one's ears with a mixture of the root of sumpatta and bhanjana, ground up, with buttermilk, black salt, and sesame oil, it cures earache.

original: krishna s'a ka'i rtsab btags na so'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: krishna s'a ka'i rtsab btags na so'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
translated: If one chews the root of krsnasâka, it cures toothache.

original: gunydza'i rtsa ba dum du bdun du byas nas srad bu bdun rked par bcings na gzhang 'brum gyi nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gunydza'i rtsa ba dum du bdun du byas nas srad bu bdun rked par bcings na gzhang 'brum gyi nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one makes seven knots in a string and ties it around one's waist with the root of gunja, it cures hemorrhoids.

original: na ba ma li'i rtsa ba ma bkrus pa bya rog ma grag pa'i dus su bde bar phyung nas srad bu bdun dang bcas pa rked par bcings na tsi t'u na sel bar byed do /
analyzed: na ba ma li'i rtsa ba ma bkrus pa bya rog ma grag pa'i dus su bde bar phyung nas srad bu bdun dang bcas pa rked par bcings na tsi t'u na sel bar byed do /
translated: If one takes out the unwashed root of the napa-mali plant before the crow caws, and ties it around one's waist with seven strings, it will remove pain in the side.

original: sma ru mgo nag//🔽pa ty'a'i la ka'i rtsa ba'i so shing zos na mig ser sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sma ru mgo nag// pa ty'a'i la ka'i rtsa ba'i so shing zos na mig ser sel bar byed do //
translated: Black-head-smara🔽If one chews the root of the patyala plant, it will remove jaundice.

original: spa'i rtsa ba bskol nas btungs na mdze nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: spa'i rtsa ba bskol nas btungs na mdze nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one boils the root of the sp plant and drinks it, it will remove leprosy.

original: skyu ru ra dang nimpa'i lo ma lhan cig btags nas zos te /
analyzed: skyu ru ra dang nimpa'i lo ma lhan cig btags nas zos te /
translated: If one eats amalaki and neem leaves together,

original: s'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / kanydzika btags nas byugs na rlung /
analyzed: s'a kho ta ka'i rtsa ba dang / kanydzika btags nas byugs na rlung /
translated: and applies a paste of the root of the sakotaka plant and kanjika, it will remove wind.

original: 'bras sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bras sel bar byed do //
translated: It will remove dysentery.

original: sa na'i rtsa ba so rtsi dang lhan cig thos na dbang po'i nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa na'i rtsa ba so rtsi dang lhan cig thos na dbang po'i nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one chews the root of the sana plant together with tooth cleaner, the disease of the sense organs will not occur.

original: 'dab ma dang bcas pa'i dman ka'i rtsa ba btags nas btungs na yongs su 'gyur ba'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dab ma dang bcas pa'i dman ka'i rtsa ba btags nas btungs na yongs su 'gyur ba'i zug rngu sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks a paste of the root of the damana plant with leaves, it will remove the pain of indigestion.

original: su warna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na rgyan rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su warna se ph'a li ka'i rtsa ba khar bcug na rgyan rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one puts a root of suvarṇasphalika in one’s mouth, one will win at gambling.

original: ba so rta ra'i si pha phyung nas lte ba'i phyogs su bcings na bud med bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba so rta ra'i si pha phyung nas lte ba'i phyogs su bcings na bud med bde bar btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one digs up a root of vṛṣa and ties it to one’s navel, one will give birth to a child easily.

original: yang dza yanti'i rtsa ba khar bcug na tha snyad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //🔽ba d'a ha  kr'anta'i rtsa ba lag pa la bcings na tha snyad kyis @292a * //
analyzed: yang dza yanti'i rtsa ba khar bcug na tha snyad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro // ba d'a ha  kr'anta'i rtsa ba lag pa la bcings na tha snyad kyis @292a * //
translated: If one puts a root of jayantī in one’s mouth, one will win in a debate.

original: mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties a root of badarakāntā to one’s hand, one will not be defeated in a debate.

original: aa pa ri dzi ta'i rtsa bskar ma rgyal la phyung nas ras bal la snum byugs te dud pa dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: aa pa ri dzi ta'i rtsa bskar ma rgyal la phyung nas ras bal la snum byugs te dud pa dbab par bya'o //
translated: If one digs up a root of aparājita under the Puṣya constellation, and fumigates it with cotton soaked in oil,

original: des mig sman byas na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mig sman byas na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become an eye salve.

original: kunda'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal la byung ste /
analyzed: kunda'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal la byung ste /
translated: If one digs up a root of kuṇḍa under the Puṣya constellation,

original: pra s'a ra ka'i gnas su bzhag na tshong rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pra s'a ra ka'i gnas su bzhag na tshong rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and places it in a prāsārika place, one will win in trade.

original: ma yu ra si kh'a'i rtsa ba rang gi khu ba dang btags nas sor mo la byugs na bud med 'dzag par the tshom med do //
analyzed: ma yu ra si kh'a'i rtsa ba rang gi khu ba dang btags nas sor mo la byugs na bud med 'dzag par the tshom med do //
translated: If one anoints one's finger with the juice of the root of mañjūṣakā mixed with one's own semen, there is no doubt that a woman will become wet.

original: rnya ma d'a ti'i rtsa ba 'dab ma dang bcas pa btags nas se pha la byugs na bud med 'dzag go / n'a ga ge sar gyi yu ba /
analyzed: rnya ma d'a ti'i rtsa ba 'dab ma dang bcas pa btags nas se pha la byugs na bud med 'dzag go / n'a ga ge sar gyi yu ba /
translated: If one anoints one's penis with the root of nyagrodhī mixed with its leaves, a woman will become wet.

original: aa sho ka'i rtsa ba dang / so rtsi dang chang (rma bya'i gtsug phud) gang la sbyin pa de'i aa matstsha ka zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: aa sho ka'i rtsa ba dang / so rtsi dang chang (rma bya'i gtsug phud) gang la sbyin pa de'i aa matstsha ka zhi bar byed do //
translated: The stalk of a nāgakesara flower, the root of an aśoka tree, and beer, if given to someone as a tooth stick, will pacify their ācāmacā.

original: su ri dang su n'a la so rtsi bcos pa zos na /
analyzed: su ri dang su n'a la so rtsi bcos pa zos na /
translated: If one eats a tooth stick made from surā and sunā,

original: khu ba rengs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba rengs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be supreme for stiffening semen.

original: bhringga r'a dza'i rtsa ba rang gi khu bar btags pas mig sman byas na /
analyzed: bhringga r'a dza'i rtsa ba rang gi khu bar btags pas mig sman byas na /
translated: If one makes an eye ointment from the root of bṛṃgarāja mixed with its juice,

original: gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de dbang du byed do //
analyzed: gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de dbang du byed do //
translated: one will enthrall whomever one sees.

original: rang gi khrag dang gi wam gis thig le byas na bud med gang mthong ba de dbang du byed do //
analyzed: rang gi khrag dang gi wam gis thig le byas na bud med gang mthong ba de dbang du byed do //
translated: If one makes a bindu with one's own blood and guggulu, one will enthrall whomever one sees.

original: byi tang ga dang / bhall'a ta ka dang / tsi tra ka dang / aa bha y'a dang / (da mo sha) sa n'a ga r'a dang mnyam pa'i ril bus mar sar lhags na gang ngal bar 'gro ba'i skyes bu de rlung dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byi tang ga dang / bhall'a ta ka dang / tsi tra ka dang / aa bha y'a dang / (da mo sha) sa n'a ga r'a dang mnyam pa'i ril bus mar sar lhags na gang ngal bar 'gro ba'i skyes bu de rlung dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The pill consisting of equal parts of bitaṅga, balātaka, citraka, abhaya, damana, and sanagara, when taken with ghee, will make the man who is exhausted by wind disease equal to the wind god.

original: bud shing gi khu ba dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / lcags kyi phye ma dang / 'dam gyi padma dang / bhringga'i khu bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bud shing gi khu ba dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / lcags kyi phye ma dang / 'dam gyi padma dang / bhringga'i khu bas kyang ngo //
translated: The juice of kindling wood, the three fruits, iron filings, mud lotus, and the juice of bhrṅga, too.

original: aarma pa bhu thun mos pa nishtam /
analyzed: aarma pa bhu thun mos pa nishtam /
translated: Armapā bhavatu nityasthitam.

original: ranydza ti ke sha ka p'a la na sandha ham /
analyzed: ranydza ti ke sha ka p'a la na sandha ham /
translated: Ranyatī keśakapālanandham.

original: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal byung nas /
analyzed: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba skar ma rgyal byung nas /
translated: The root of white guggulu, when the star Puṣya appears,

original: te na dashta ka sya na sam p'a ma n'a si k'a ya: pra te pra dotte tsantsha te /
analyzed: te na dashta ka sya na sam p'a ma n'a si k'a ya: pra te pra dotte tsantsha te /
translated: Ten days after, it will become a medicine for stopping blood, when cut and pulled out.

original: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba rked pa la bcings na bdag nyid kyi khrag sel par byed do //
analyzed: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba rked pa la bcings na bdag nyid kyi khrag sel par byed do //
translated: The root of white guggulu, when bound around the waist, will stop one's own blood.

original: de'i rtsa ba skye gnas la byug par byin na mngal bsdams pa btsa' bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba skye gnas la byug par byin na mngal bsdams pa btsa' bar byed do //
translated: If one anoints the root of the plant with this, the womb will be closed and the delivery will be induced.

original: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba phye ma zhi ba mor byas nas ma he'i 'o ma la bcug na zho smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gunydza dkar po'i rtsa ba phye ma zhi ba mor byas nas ma he'i 'o ma la bcug na zho smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one grinds the root of white guñjā, puts it in buffalo milk, and makes it into curds, it will ripen.

original: s'a kho ta ka'i 'o ma thigs pa gnyis bcug ste /
analyzed: s'a kho ta ka'i 'o ma thigs pa gnyis bcug ste /
translated: One should put two drops of the milk of the śākoṭa tree.

original: legs par smin pa nyi ma gsum pa la bsrubs @292b pa'i mar gsar blangs te /
analyzed: legs par smin pa nyi ma gsum pa la bsrubs @292b pa'i mar gsar blangs te /
translated: One should take the fresh butter from the third day of churning.

original: dar ba / ta kranytsa dza hva s'a pa ya /
analyzed: dar ba / ta kranytsa dza hva s'a pa ya /
translated: darbha, takra, and cow’s urine.

original: me tog dkar po gtor bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dkar po gtor bya'o //
translated: One should scatter white flowers.

original: nyi ma gzhan la de'i me tog nag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la de'i me tog nag por 'gyur ro //
translated: On another day, its flowers will turn black.

original: mar sar des thod par mig sman du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar sar des thod par mig sman du 'gyur ro //
translated: That fresh butter will become eye ointment in a skull.

original: dzam b'i ra'i rtsa ba btags na /
analyzed: dzam b'i ra'i rtsa ba btags na /
translated: If one grinds the root of jambīra,

original: dzanti ka'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dzanti ka'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: it will cure jaundice.

original: pann'ag  pa ti ka'i rtsa ba btags na bems po'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: pann'ag  pa ti ka'i rtsa ba btags na bems po'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one grinds the root of pannaka, it will cure paralysis.

original: ri tu b'i t'i'i 'byung po'i nyi ma bzhi pa la n'a ga ge sar gyi lo ma dang / kha dog gcig pa'i ba'i 'o ma btungs na /
analyzed: ri tu b'i t'i'i 'byung po'i nyi ma bzhi pa la n'a ga ge sar gyi lo ma dang / kha dog gcig pa'i ba'i 'o ma btungs na /
translated: On the fourth day of the four-day cycle of the Ritutaitibhuta, if one drinks cow's milk the color of a nāgapuṣpa flower,

original: nyi ma bzhi pa la skyes bu'i mdze nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma bzhi pa la skyes bu'i mdze nad sel bar byed do //
translated: on the fourth day of the four-day cycle of the Ritutaitibhuta, it will cure leprosy.

original: skyu ru ra ge sar las skyes pa'i khu ba dang lhan cig lcags kyi snod du btags te mig sman byas na rab rib sel bar byed do //
analyzed: skyu ru ra ge sar las skyes pa'i khu ba dang lhan cig lcags kyi snod du btags te mig sman byas na rab rib sel bar byed do //
translated: If one makes an eye ointment of the juice of a myrobalan flower mixed with iron filings, it will cure blurred vision.🔽If one drinks a mixture of the root of pūrnāva and the root of sobhājana with water from a rice paddy, it is the best remedy for bile.

original: p'u narna wa'i rtsa ba dang / so so bhanydza na'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags nas de nyid btungs na mkhris pa sel ba'i mchog go / tandu li k'a'i rtsa bas mkha' 'gro ma'i gdon dag gis bzung ba'i snying gi zug rngu sel bar byed do //
analyzed: p'u narna wa'i rtsa ba dang / so so bhanydza na'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags nas de nyid btungs na mkhris pa sel ba'i mchog go / tandu li k'a'i rtsa bas mkha' 'gro ma'i gdon dag gis bzung ba'i snying gi zug rngu sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of tandulīka cures the pain of the heart seized by the graha of the ḍākinī.

original: kanytsa n'a'i rtsa ba dang / shun pa dang / dar ba mnyam par btungs na zas kyis brnangs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: kanytsa n'a'i rtsa ba dang / shun pa dang / dar ba mnyam par btungs na zas kyis brnangs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root, bark, and fruit of kañcana in equal parts, it will cure choking on food.

original: a'i shva ra'i rtsa ba dang kanydzi ka btags nas byugs na gdug pa'i rma sel bar byed do //
analyzed: a'i shva ra'i rtsa ba dang kanydzi ka btags nas byugs na gdug pa'i rma sel bar byed do //
translated: A paste of aśvārī and kañjikā cures poisonous wounds.

original: de bzhin du gdug pa'i rma'i gnas su byug par yang bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdug pa'i rma'i gnas su byug par yang bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should apply a paste to the site of a poisonous wound.

original: tri s'u li k'a'i rtsa ba btags nas byug par byin na /
analyzed: tri s'u li k'a'i rtsa ba btags nas byug par byin na /
translated: A paste of the root of trisūlikā cures

original: dug nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dug nad sel bar byed do //
translated: poisoning.

original: tandu li k'a'i 'dab ma dang bcas pa'i rtsa ba dang / aagni bastu ka'i rtsa ba'i khu ba btags nas lus la byugs na bcud skam sel bar byed do //
analyzed: tandu li k'a'i 'dab ma dang bcas pa'i rtsa ba dang / aagni bastu ka'i rtsa ba'i khu ba btags nas lus la byugs na bcud skam sel bar byed do //
translated: A paste of the root of tandulīya together with the leaves and the juice of agnistu cures wasting diseases.

original: su darsha ka'i rtsa ba btags nas byugs na mig nad zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: su darsha ka'i rtsa ba btags nas byugs na mig nad zhi bar byed do //
translated: A paste of sudarśa cures eye diseases.

original: go dzi hve'i rtsa ba ras bal la bcings na tha snyad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go dzi hve'i rtsa ba ras bal la bcings na tha snyad las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A root of gojihva bound to cotton will bring victory in debate.

original: aa shva gandha'i rtsa ba mar dang lhan cig btungs na mngal brtan par byed pa'i mchog go / su ra bha ti ga ra'i rtsa ba btags nas byugs na srin bu l'u ta'i dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: aa shva gandha'i rtsa ba mar dang lhan cig btungs na mngal brtan par byed pa'i mchog go / su ra bha ti ga ra'i rtsa ba btags nas byugs na srin bu l'u ta'i dug sel bar byed do //
translated: Aśvagandhā root drunk with ghee is the best for stabilizing the womb. A paste of the root of surābhaṭī cures lūta poison.

original: gi r'i karni ka'i rtsa ba btags na lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gi r'i karni ka'i rtsa ba btags na lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
translated: If one chews the root of girikarṇikā, it will cure throat cancer.

original: autpal sngon po dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rtsa ba so rtsir gyi na na  @293a * //
analyzed: autpal sngon po dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rtsa ba so rtsir gyi na na  @293a * //
translated: If one uses as a tooth-stick the root of blue lotus or aparājitā,

original: dbang du byed pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: dbang du byed pa'i mchog go //
translated: it is the best for subjugation.

original: aa p'a m'arga'i rtsa ba dang / rgyam tsha dang / ga ma dzi ka lhan cig zangs kyi snod du sbyar nas mig sman byas na mig tshag pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: aa p'a m'arga'i rtsa ba dang / rgyam tsha dang / ga ma dzi ka lhan cig zangs kyi snod du sbyar nas mig sman byas na mig tshag pa sel bar byed do //
translated: If one prepares an eye-salve by combining the root of apāmārga, black salt, and gañjikā in a copper vessel, it will cure eye pain.

original: dza yanta'i rtsa ba til mar gyis smin par byas nas zos na bcud nyams par byed do //
analyzed: dza yanta'i rtsa ba til mar gyis smin par byas nas zos na bcud nyams par byed do //
translated: If one eats the root of jayantī, cooked in oil, it will cure loss of semen.

original: ka ranydza'i rtsa ba dang / ma h'a k'a la'i rtsa ba dang / ta nu la'i chu btung bar byin na sa'i dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ka ranydza'i rtsa ba dang / ma h'a k'a la'i rtsa ba dang / ta nu la'i chu btung bar byin na sa'i dug sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks water in which the root of karṇajā, the root of mahākāla, and the root of tanula have been boiled, it will cure poisoning by earth.

original: de bzhin du bu na rna b'a dkar po'i rtsa ba phyung nas sna bug tu byin na gdug pa'i dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bu na rna b'a dkar po'i rtsa ba phyung nas sna bug tu byin na gdug pa'i dug sel bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, if one removes the root of white bunaf and inserts it into the nostrils, it will cure poisoning by snakes.

original: p'a tha'i rtsa ba dang ba dang lhan cig btungs na tshad pas 'khru ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: p'a tha'i rtsa ba dang ba dang lhan cig btungs na tshad pas 'khru ba sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of pāṭhā together with milk, it cures dysentery.

original: mand'a r'a'i rtsa ba 'o ma dang lhan cig btungs na rlung nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mand'a r'a'i rtsa ba 'o ma dang lhan cig btungs na rlung nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one drinks the root of mandāragā together with milk, it cures wind disorders.

original: aarka'i rtsa ba dang / ri shi p'u to li ka'i rtsa ba sa bon dang lhan cig cha mnyam par byas nas chu dang btags te bshang lam du byugs na gzhang 'brum sel bar byed do //
analyzed: aarka'i rtsa ba dang / ri shi p'u to li ka'i rtsa ba sa bon dang lhan cig cha mnyam par byas nas chu dang btags te bshang lam du byugs na gzhang 'brum sel bar byed do //
translated: If one mixes the root of arka and the root of rishipūtī together with seeds, makes them into a paste with water, and applies it to the anus, it cures hemorrhoids.

original: dri s'u li ka'i rtsa ba 'o ma dang btags te gi wam dang lhan cig zangs kyi snod du bzhag nas mig la byugs na /
analyzed: dri s'u li ka'i rtsa ba 'o ma dang btags te gi wam dang lhan cig zangs kyi snod du bzhag nas mig la byugs na /
translated: If one mixes the root of dīpyakā together with milk, adds pippalī, and places it in a copper vessel, and then applies it to the eyes,

original: rab rib sel bar byed do //
analyzed: rab rib sel bar byed do //
translated: it cures eye diseases.

original: aa ru ra dang / zhu mkhan dang / lung thang gi 'dab ma dang / shing kun dang / shu dag rnams chu dang lhan cig btags nas gal te sos btab na 'chi ba de'i tshe yang 'di byin na rnal du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ru ra dang / zhu mkhan dang / lung thang gi 'dab ma dang / shing kun dang / shu dag rnams chu dang lhan cig btags nas gal te sos btab na 'chi ba de'i tshe yang 'di byin na rnal du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mixes together yellow myrobalan, śigru, the leaf of lunteng, devadāru, and śirīṣa together with water, and if one plants it in a corpse, it will return to life.

original: ko ki l'aksha'i rtsa ba dang / ku d'u tsi dang / ba sha ka dang / dbyug pa'i autpal dang / su wa rtses ph'a li ka'i sa bon dang / bri ha ti'i rtsa ba dang / cha mnyam par byas nas yungs kar gyi snum dang lhan cig btungs na rkang 'bam dang rlung nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ko ki l'aksha'i rtsa ba dang / ku d'u tsi dang / ba sha ka dang / dbyug pa'i autpal dang / su wa rtses ph'a li ka'i sa bon dang / bri ha ti'i rtsa ba dang / cha mnyam par byas nas yungs kar gyi snum dang lhan cig btungs na rkang 'bam dang rlung nad sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of kokilaksha, kudzu, vasaka, dhanvayasa, the seed of suvarchika, and the root of brihati, taken in equal parts and drunk together with mustard oil, cures elephantiasis and vata disorders.

original: go dzi tra'i rtsa ba dar ba dang lhan cig btungs na rked pa'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: go dzi tra'i rtsa ba dar ba dang lhan cig btungs na rked pa'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of gojihva, drunk together with buttermilk, cures waist disorders.

original: autpa la'i rtsa ba ba'i mar dang lhan cig btungs na prisha na'i klung sel bar byed do //
analyzed: autpa la'i rtsa ba ba'i mar dang lhan cig btungs na prisha na'i klung sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of utpala, drunk together with ghee, cures dysentery.

original: ku dza ta'i rtsa ba phye mar byas nas sbrang dang lhan cig byin na rtsa'i rma sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ku dza ta'i rtsa ba phye mar byas nas sbrang dang lhan cig byin na rtsa'i rma sel bar byed do //
translated: The root of kuzhata, made into a powder and given together with honey, heals wounds in the channels.

original: pa ra me sva ra'i rtsab dang shu dag byugs na 'bras sel bar byed do /
analyzed: pa ra me sva ra'i rtsab dang shu dag byugs na 'bras sel bar byed do /
translated: The root and flowers of paramesha, applied as an ointment, cures hemorrhoids.

original: sundi k'a'i rtsa ba dang / lga dang lhan cig lag pa la byugs na mi rengs par byed do //
analyzed: sundi k'a'i rtsa ba dang / lga dang lhan cig lag pa la byugs na mi rengs par byed do //
translated: The root of sundika, applied to the hand together with lac, prevents stiffness.

original: bandhu @293b ki'i rtsa ba snar byin na sna nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bandhu @293b ki'i rtsa ba snar byin na sna nad sel bar byed do //
translated: If one puts the root of bandhuka in the nose, it cures a disease of the nose.

original: b'a r'a ha kr'anta'i rtsa ba yungs kar gyi mar dang lhan cig khar bcug na /
analyzed: b'a r'a ha kr'anta'i rtsa ba yungs kar gyi mar dang lhan cig khar bcug na /
translated: If one puts the root of vārāhakāntā in the mouth together with mustard oil,

original: skye bo thams cad kyi mig 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyi mig 'ching bar byed do //
translated: it binds the eyes of all people.

original: pra th'a m'a lam /
analyzed: pra th'a m'a lam /
translated: [One should say:] “prathamalam.”

original: aom khang+ga w'a ri n'i sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom khang+ga w'a ri n'i sv'ah'a /
translated: “Oṃ khaṅgavāriṇi svāhā.”

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis kha la btab nas mtshon bza' bar bya'o//
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis kha la btab nas mtshon bza' bar bya'o//
translated: Having recited this mantra, one should eat the weapon.

original: aaga ru dang / gu gul dang / shr'i w'a sa dang / tsan dan dang / ne p'a li k'a'i 'dab ma dang / nirm'as rnams bu ram dang lhan cig cha mnyam par byas nas bdag nyid bdugs te /
analyzed: aaga ru dang / gu gul dang / shr'i w'a sa dang / tsan dan dang / ne p'a li k'a'i 'dab ma dang / nirm'as rnams bu ram dang lhan cig cha mnyam par byas nas bdag nyid bdugs te /
translated: One should make a paste of agaru, guggula, śrīvasa, sandalwood, leaves of nepālika, and nirvāsa, together with molasses, and fumigate oneself with it.

original: rgyal po'i 'pho bang  du phyin na skye bo thams cad kyis de'i dri snom par byed cing /
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'pho bang  du phyin na skye bo thams cad kyis de'i dri snom par byed cing /
translated: If one goes to the king’s palace, all people will smell its fragrance

original: thams cad mngag gzhug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mngag gzhug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and will become one’s servants.

original: til nag po dang / skyu ru ra dang / bhringga r'a dza dang / 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas mar dang lhan cig zos na skra dkar dang / rab rib dang / skya rbab rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: til nag po dang / skyu ru ra dang / bhringga r'a dza dang / 'di dag cha mnyam par byas nas mar dang lhan cig zos na skra dkar dang / rab rib dang / skya rbab rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: Black sesame seeds, sour fruits, and bhringaraja - when these are taken in equal parts and consumed with ghee, they eliminate gray hair, cataracts, and edema.

original: k'a ka dzi gha'i rang bzhin bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: k'a ka dzi gha'i rang bzhin bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain the nature of kakajangha.

original: sman chen po k'a ka dzi gha aa ti b'a l'a /
analyzed: sman chen po k'a ka dzi gha aa ti b'a l'a /
translated: The great medicine is kakajangha atibala.

original: de bzhin du ba la nam dang / ba randu'i 'dab ma dang / khu ba dang / yungs kar dkar po dang / mandu ka'i ril ma bre gang gis smin par byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba la nam dang / ba randu'i 'dab ma dang / khu ba dang / yungs kar dkar po dang / mandu ka'i ril ma bre gang gis smin par byas te /
translated: Similarly, with balanama, the leaf of a blue lotus, juice, white mustard seeds, and one prastha of manduka parilla, it is cooked.

original: 'dis rtsa ba bkrus na chu klung gi shugs kyang zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis rtsa ba bkrus na chu klung gi shugs kyang zhi bar byed do //
translated: If the roots are washed with this, even the force of a river will be pacified.

original: k'a ka dzam gh'a'i khu ba blangs te /
analyzed: k'a ka dzam gh'a'i khu ba blangs te /
translated: Take the juice of kakajangha.

original: 'di'i rtsa ba dang btags nas rma la btab na rma gso ba'i mchog go //
analyzed: 'di'i rtsa ba dang btags nas rma la btab na rma gso ba'i mchog go //
translated: When the roots are ground with this and applied to a wound, it is the best for healing wounds.

original: 'di'i 'dab ma dang / 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags te bkrus shing bskams nas rma til mar gyis bkang na rtsa gso ba'i mchog go /'di'i 'dab ma'i khu ba dang / ba lang gi chu lhan cig khas bzung na kha'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i 'dab ma dang / 'bras thug po che'i chu dang btags te bkrus shing bskams nas rma til mar gyis bkang na rtsa gso ba'i mchog go /'di'i 'dab ma'i khu ba dang / ba lang gi chu lhan cig khas bzung na kha'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: The leaves of this plant, mixed with water and roasted barley flour, should be used as a compress. When the wound is filled with sesame oil, it is the best for healing. The juice of its leaves, when held in the mouth together with cow’s urine, removes mouth diseases.

original: k'a ka dzam gh'a dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / bhreng+ga r'a dza'i khu ba blangs nas /
analyzed: k'a ka dzam gh'a dang / skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang / bhreng+ga r'a dza'i khu ba blangs nas /
translated: Take the juice of kākajaṅgha, āmalaka, bhṛṅgarāja, and

original: til mar gyis smin par byas na khi nya 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: til mar gyis smin par byas na khi nya 'phel bar byed do //
translated: when ripened with sesame oil, it increases semen.

original: thos pa rengs pa sel bar byed do //🔽sbrang dang lhan cig gis lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
analyzed: thos pa rengs pa sel bar byed do // sbrang dang lhan cig gis lkog 'bras sel bar byed do //
translated: It removes deafness.🔽When taken with honey, it removes throat obstruction.

original: bhall'a ta ka dang / lhan cig zos na mdze nad sel bar byed do //🔽mar sar dang lhan cig gis skyigs bu'i nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: bhall'a ta ka dang / lhan cig zos na mdze nad sel bar byed do // mar sar dang lhan cig gis skyigs bu'i nad sel bar byed do //
translated: When eaten together with bhallas, it removes leprosy.🔽When taken with ghee, it removes hiccups.

original: spos dkar dang lhan cig gis mtshan bar rdol ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: spos dkar dang lhan cig gis mtshan bar rdol ba sel bar byed do //
translated: When taken with śvetasiddhaka, it removes anal fistula.

original: khanda dang lhan cig gis kha @294a * //
analyzed: khanda dang lhan cig gis kha @294a * //
translated: When taken with khaṇḍa, it removes

original: nad sel par byed do //
analyzed: nad sel par byed do //
translated: It cures diseases.

original: ba'i chu dang lhan cig gis me dbal sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ba'i chu dang lhan cig gis me dbal sel bar byed do //
translated: It cures erysipelas when taken with the water of the cow.

original: 'phags pa rtsa ba'i mdzod sman chen po'i rim pa slob dpon dpal ldan 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'phags pa rtsa ba'i mdzod sman chen po'i rim pa slob dpon dpal ldan 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs so//
translated: The chapter on the great medicine of the noble Root Tantra, composed by the master glorious noble Nāgārjuna, is complete.
